intro: Microseris brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, round seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. Microseris brevipes is adapted to arid environments and is known for its resilience to drought conditions.
